cookies-policies.cookies-policy: We use optional cookies to improve your experience on our website understanding how you use it so we can improve it. If you reject optional cookies, only cookies necessary to provide you the services will be used.

acr-info.title: How To
acr-info.intro:
In order to host your demo, it must be containerized on Docker. This requirement allows us to standardize the hosting of asset demos.
Please push your image to our instance of Azure Container Registry (ACR) and fill the image name in the following form.
Be sure your application works with relatives path and does not have any reference to the root (example: links to "/yourfile.js" should be "yourfile.js" or "./yourfile.js")
Before starting you need to join the Security Group that will enable you to access the ACR clicking
acr-info.body: Give approximately 30 minutes for the changes to be propagated to be sure you have access to the ACR. Then execute the following Azure CLI instructions in a Powershell terminal to authenticate, build and push the image:
acr-info.footer: Please use the Comments field to add any requirements or specific configurations that might be needed for these images.

asset.name: Asset Name
asset.description-placeholder: Describe the accelerator: what it does, how it does, etc. You may copy the content of your repository's README file.
asset.business-problem-placeholder: Describe the problem that you are solving with the accelerator or that you are showcasing with the demo. For example: identifying faulty parts in a manufacturing plant, identifying new customers, optimising scheduling operations, etc.
asset.business-value-placeholder: Describe the value that the clients are getting from the solution through. It could be specific metrics or KPI established during the project (number of new customers, energy consumption) from OKRS, or simply examples like "cost reduction", "sales increase", "time reduction", etc.
asset.modeling-approach-and-training-placehold: If applicable, explain what AI/ML/statistical approach you used to solve the problem. If not, simply provide an "NA" or "-" character.
asset.data-placeholder: If applicable, provide a high-level description of your data like type (audio, textual, tabular, …).
asset.workflow-url-placeholder: If applicable, provide the GitHub Workflow Url that deploys the asset.
asset.architecture-placeholder: Provide a list of Azure components used in the accelerator (Azure Machine Learning, Synapse, Kubernetes, …).
asset.arm-template-placeholder: If available, provide a link to the ARM Template
asset.repository-url-info: To facilitate the review process we recommend you to join the Microsoft Open Source organization on Github by linking your Github account. https://repos.opensource.microsoft.com/link
asset.comments-placeholder: Any comments you'd like to share with us. They will not appear in the description of the accelerator's page.

blog.title: Title
blog.introduction-infopopover: This information is shown only in the blog list but not in the blog post detailed page

home.title: Discover your toolkit
home.subtitle: The data science toolkit is an open-source collection of proven ML and AI implementation accelerators. Accelerators enable the automation of commonly repeated development processes to allow data science practitioners focus on delivering complex business value and spend less time on basic setup.
home.no-results-no-match: We couldn't find a match for ‘{{query}}’

editor.submitted-ok: Thank you. The asset was submitted for evaluation.
editor.updated-ok: Thank you. The asset was updated.
editor.contact-intro:
1. Access the GitHub repo with the asset of interest.
2. Once you are in the repo:
-Check for open issues and choose the issue you would like to contribute to.
-Assign the issue to yourself.
-Create a branch with the feature/issue name (please pay attention nomenclature to avoid confusion).
-Submit your branch for review.
-If approved, merge with master. If not, edit accordingly.
-If you found an issue but there is no existing one, create it and follow the above steps.
editor.contact-additional: Contact us if you have additional questions.
editor.contact-placeholder: Enter any additional questions or comments here.
editor.contact-sent: Thank you for your inquiry. We will get back to you soon.
